fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Research and innovation, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives:
Policies in relation to social inclusion, social enterprise, equality, unemployment, training, innovation, local development. 
 
Current projects seeking to identify possible actions and policies in those areas: Erasmus+ in relation to innovation and sharing of expertise in VET as relevant to the above policy areas.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Commission expert group on social economy and social enterprises #E03576#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3576#Member#C
membership: European network of innovation for inclusion
relevant_communication:
EQUAL - SONAS Programme – EU funded EQUAL programme dealing with Asylum Seekers with partners from Cork,Dublin, Limerick and Wexford. 
EQUAL EMERGE – (2005) – Ethnic minority entrepreneurship 
EQUAL Senior Select Retrain Retain – (2005) – Older age employment 
WISELINK – Interreg IIIA (2001) - Wales & Ireland Social Economy Link, capacity building programme for community businesses. 
WINSENT – Interreg 4a (2009) – Wales Ireland Network for Social Entrepreneurship 
SPIDER - Interreg IVB (2013) Social Innovation through service design. 
IV4J - Erasmus+ (current) Innovation in VET for jobs. 
RISE - Erasmus+ (current) examination of causes of failure in social enterprise.
goals__remit:
Mission Statement: 
 
Our aim is to build an inclusive and thriving community by being a leading source of excellence in development of local enterprise and of social economy. 
Objectives:( n)( n)To foster and support entrepreneurship within the community through appropriate business training, mentoring and ongoing support.( n) ( n)To create improved opportunities for sustainable employment within all sectors of the local community through lifelong training, re-training, personal and business development programmes.( n) ( n)To effectively manage, develop and maintain enterprise centres for the community, which offer affordable workspace in support of local enterprise and act as focal points for local community development.( n) ( n)To support the innovative development of the social economy through new approaches to analysing, understanding and developing all aspects of the sector at local, national and European levels.( n) ( n)To encourage inclusivity through continual analysis of and proactive responses to the needs of marginalized groups within the community.( n) ( n)To promote the highest standards of service, commitment and professionalism within our own organisation as a means of meeting our mission objectives and of enhancing the personal and career development of all our staff.( n) ( n)To act as a voice and as an agent for change on issues relevant to the above
